Nib
  • Nib  
  • nib.services package

nib.services package

System services for accessing device information.

This module provides access to system services like battery status, network connectivity, screen brightness, and keychain.

Note

Launch at login is configured via pyproject.toml at build time:

[tool.nib.build]
launch_at_login = true

Example

Using battery service:

from nib.services import Battery

def check_battery(app: nib.App):
    Battery.get_status(app, lambda info: print(f"Level: {info.level}%"))

Using connectivity service:

from nib.services import Connectivity

def check_network(app: nib.App):
    Connectivity.get_status(app, lambda info: print(f"Type: {info.type}"))

Using keychain service:

from nib.services import Keychain

def save_token(app: nib.App):
    Keychain.set(app, "MyApp", "api_token", "secret123")
class nib.services.Battery[source]

Bases: object

Service for accessing battery information.

This is a static service class - all methods are class methods that require an App instance for communication with the Swift runtime.

Example

Check battery level:

def main(app: nib.App):
    def on_battery(info: BatteryInfo):
        if info.level and info.level < 20:
            app.notify("Low Battery", f"{info.level}% remaining")

    Battery.get_status(app, on_battery)
classmethod get_status(app, callback)[source]

Get current battery status.

Parameters:

  • app (App) The App instance for runtime communication.

  • callback (Callable[[BatteryInfo], None]) Function called with BatteryInfo when data is available.

Return type:

None

Example

Get battery info:

Battery.get_status(app, lambda info: print(f"Level: {info.level}%"))
class nib.services.BatteryInfo(level, is_charging, state, is_low_power_mode, has_battery, time_remaining=None)[source]

Bases: object

Battery status information.

level

Battery level as percentage (0-100). None if not available.

is_charging

Whether the battery is currently charging.

state

Detailed battery state.

is_low_power_mode

Whether low power mode is enabled.

has_battery

Whether the device has a battery.

time_remaining

Estimated minutes remaining. None if not available.

Parameters:

  • level (Optional[float])

  • is_charging (bool)

  • state (BatteryState)

  • is_low_power_mode (bool)

  • has_battery (bool)

  • time_remaining (Optional[int])

level: Optional[float]
is_charging: bool
state: BatteryState
is_low_power_mode: bool
has_battery: bool
time_remaining: Optional[int] = None
classmethod from_dict(data)[source]

Parameters:

data (dict)

Return type:

BatteryInfo

Parameters:

  • level (Optional[float])

  • is_charging (bool)

  • state (BatteryState)

  • is_low_power_mode (bool)

  • has_battery (bool)

  • time_remaining (Optional[int])

class nib.services.Connectivity[source]

Bases: object

Service for accessing network connectivity information.

This is a static service class - all methods are class methods that require an App instance for communication with the Swift runtime.

Example

Check network status before downloading:

def main(app: nib.App):
    def on_network(info: ConnectivityInfo):
        if not info.is_connected:
            app.notify("Offline", "No network connection")
        elif info.is_expensive:
            app.notify("Metered Connection", "Using cellular data")

    Connectivity.get_status(app, on_network)
classmethod get_status(app, callback)[source]

Get current network connectivity status.

Parameters:

  • app (App) The App instance for runtime communication.

  • callback (Callable[[ConnectivityInfo], None]) Function called with ConnectivityInfo when data is available.

Return type:

None

Example

Get network info:

Connectivity.get_status(app, lambda info: print(f"Type: {info.type}"))
class nib.services.ConnectivityInfo(is_connected, type, is_expensive, is_constrained, ssid=None, interface_name=None)[source]

Bases: object

Network connectivity information.

is_connected

Whether theres an active network connection.

type

The type of network connection.

is_expensive

Whether the connection is metered/expensive (cellular).

is_constrained

Whether the connection is constrained (low data mode).

ssid

WiFi network name if connected to WiFi. None otherwise.

interface_name

Name of the active network interface.

Parameters:

  • is_connected (bool)

  • type (ConnectionType)

  • is_expensive (bool)

  • is_constrained (bool)

  • ssid (Optional[str])

  • interface_name (Optional[str])

is_connected: bool
type: ConnectionType
is_expensive: bool
is_constrained: bool
ssid: Optional[str] = None
interface_name: Optional[str] = None

class nib.services.Screen[source]

Bases: object

Service for accessing and controlling screen brightness.

This is a static service class - all methods are class methods that require an App instance for communication with the Swift runtime.

Note

Setting brightness may require accessibility permissions on macOS.

Example

Dim screen at night:

def main(app: nib.App):
    def on_screen(info: ScreenInfo):
        if info.brightness > 0.3:
            Screen.set_brightness(app, 0.3)

    Screen.get_info(app, on_screen)
classmethod get_info(app, callback)[source]

Get current screen information.

Parameters:

  • app (App) The App instance for runtime communication.

  • callback (Callable[[ScreenInfo], None]) Function called with ScreenInfo when data is available.

Return type:

None

Example

Get screen brightness:

Screen.get_info(app, lambda info: print(f"Brightness: {info.brightness}"))
classmethod set_brightness(app, brightness, callback=None)[source]

Set screen brightness.

Parameters:

  • app (App) The App instance for runtime communication.

  • brightness (float) Brightness level from 0.0 (darkest) to 1.0 (brightest).

  • callback (Optional[Callable[[bool], None]]) Optional function called with success status.

Return type:

None

Example

Set brightness to 50%:

Screen.set_brightness(app, 0.5)

Set brightness with confirmation:

Screen.set_brightness(app, 0.8, lambda ok: print(f"Set: {ok}"))
class nib.services.ScreenInfo(brightness, is_builtin, width, height, scale)[source]

Bases: object

Screen information.

brightness

Current brightness level (0.0 to 1.0).

is_builtin

Whether this is the built-in display.

width

Screen width in points.

height

Screen height in points.

scale

Display scale factor (e.g., 2.0 for Retina).

Parameters:

  • brightness (float)

  • is_builtin (bool)

  • width (float)

  • height (float)

  • scale (float)

brightness: float
is_builtin: bool
width: float
height: float
scale: float

  • is_builtin (bool)

  • width (float)

  • height (float)

  • scale (float)

class nib.services.Keychain[source]

Bases: object

Service for secure credential storage using macOS Keychain.

The Keychain service provides secure storage for sensitive data like passwords, API tokens, and other credentials. Data is encrypted and stored in the system keychain.

All operations are asynchronous and return results via callbacks.

Example

Store and retrieve a password:

def main(app: nib.App):
    # Store a password
    Keychain.set(
        app,
        service="MyApp",
        account="user@example.com",
        password="secret123",
        callback=lambda ok: print(f"Stored: {ok}"),
    )

    # Retrieve a password
    def on_password(password: str | None):
        if password:
            print(f"Password: {password}")
        else:
            print("Not found")

    Keychain.get(app, service="MyApp", account="user@example.com", callback=on_password)

Delete a credential:

Keychain.delete(
    app,
    service="MyApp",
    account="user@example.com",
    callback=lambda ok: print(f"Deleted: {ok}"),
)
classmethod get(app, service, account, callback)[source]

Retrieve a password from the keychain.

Parameters:

  • app (App) The App instance.

  • service (str) Service name (usually your app identifier).

  • account (str) Account name (username, email, etc.).

  • callback (Callable[[Optional[str]], None]) Function called with the password or None if not found.

Return type:

None

classmethod set(app, service, account, password, callback=None)[source]

Store a password in the keychain.

If an entry already exists for the service/account combination, it will be updated.

Parameters:

  • app (App) The App instance.

  • service (str) Service name (usually your app identifier).

  • account (str) Account name (username, email, etc.).

  • password (str) The password/secret to store.

  • callback (Optional[Callable[[bool], None]]) Optional function called with success status.

Return type:

None

classmethod delete(app, service, account, callback=None)[source]

Delete a password from the keychain.

Parameters:

  • app (App) The App instance.

  • service (str) Service name.

  • account (str) Account name.

  • callback (Optional[Callable[[bool], None]]) Optional function called with success status.

Return type:

None

classmethod exists(app, service, account, callback)[source]

Check if a keychain entry exists.

Parameters:

  • app (App) The App instance.

  • service (str) Service name.

  • account (str) Account name.

  • callback (Callable[[bool], None]) Function called with True if exists, False otherwise.

Return type:

None
